title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING AND GOOD GOVERN

description.narrative: Central and decentralized authorities and key stakeholders increasingly monitor child rights through an integrated monitoring mechanism to support evidence-based policies for the well-being of disadvantaged children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Human Rights Institutions, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Public authorities, in partnership with civil society, international organizations and the private sector, will exercise good governance to reduce child deprivation and advance the rights of girls and boys, both nationally and sub-nationally

participating-org.narrative: AUTORITATEA NATIONALA PENTRU DREPTURILE PERSOANELOR CU DIZABILIT COPII SI ADOPTII
INSTITUTUL NATIONAL DE SANATATE PUB NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR PUBLIC HEALT

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Central and decentralized authorities and key stakeholders increasingly monitor child rights through an integrated monitoringmechanism to support evidence-based policies for the well-being of disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: The National Authorities used UNICEF expertise and models to improve the normative framework, mobilise resources for vulnerable children, share good practices with other countries and improve the child rights monitoring system | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2018

title.narrative: Value of EU structural funds and other resources leveraged for children
. % of children and families benefiting from the integrated package of services provided by outreach community workers in the communities covered by the Minimum Package of Services model in Bacau
Content of Partnership Agreement and Operational Programmes developed in the framework of EU structural funds with regard to vulnerable children and their families, including Roma.

baseline.value: Draft Partnership Agreement with GOR addresses vulnerable children's rights, Operational Programmes not in place

title.narrative: Status of the Parliament's use of the Ombudsman's Report on child rights
Status of child rights monitoring systems, comprising i) data collection and analysis, ii) coordination and data exchange among systems, iii) the use of data by decision makers, and, dissemination.

baseline.value: i) Inconsistent data collection methods and analyses, ii) partial coordination and data exchange, iii) unsystematic use by decision makers, and, irregular dissemination

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Updated CRC report available

target.value: 2017:report available and largely distributed at decision level

target.value: 2017:strategy exists and has an implementation plan

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

target.value: 2017:strategy exists and has an implementation plan

title.narrative: Minimum Package of Services (MPS) tested in Bacau model integrated in normative framework and policies at national level.

actual.value: 2018:The MPS is incorporated in various National Strategies and the new cross-ministerial order on community-based services.
